Events that occurred on 2 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1901 - Poet Roy Campbell is born.
1937 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 15b.
1937 - C.S. Lewis publishes a review of The Hobbit in The Times Literary Supplement.
1947 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to A.W. Riddle.
1954 - J.R.R. Tolkien receives an honorary doctorate from the University of Li√®ge.
1976 - Oxonmoot 1976 at The Welsh Pony.
1979 - The Jackanory episode "Over Hill and Under Hill" is aired on the BBC.
1980 - Unfinished Tales is first published in the UK.
1982 - The twelfth episode of the new version of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
2009 - Ring*Con 2009 in Bonn, Germany.
2010 - Jubilee for Mithlond, the Gothenburg Tolkien Society of Sweden.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Together with Strider the four hobbits travel towards Weathertop. They enter the Midgewater Marshes.
Gandalf travels towards Weathertop as well.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
